definition: to check/to contain/to hold back/to keep within limits/to constrain/to restrain
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: And all of this, of course, ignores the benefits of limiting global warming.
sentences.chinese: 而所有這一切都忽略了遏制全球變暖所帶來的好處。

sentences.english: The admonition was prompted by Bush's rebuke of how China stifles free speech and religion.
sentences.chinese: 這個警告是對布什指責中國遏制言論和宗教信仰自由。

sentences.english: To establish the public trust in media, news propagation must be banned.
sentences.chinese: 樹立媒介公信力，必須遏制新聞炒作。

sentences.english: But all these years the strange practice has been going on unchecked.
sentences.chinese: 但是這些年來這詭異的儀式未受遏制的一直延續下來。

sentences.english: Forcing too much liquidity on banks stifles credit.
sentences.chinese: 強制銀行流動性過多，將會遏制銀行信貸。

sentences.english: The strategic use of the appropriate vaccines to contain and isolate disease clusters
sentences.chinese: 策略地使用適當疫苗以遏制和隔離患病畜羣。

sentences.english: In so doing, innovation and competition would be stifled.
sentences.chinese: 創新和競爭就被這樣的行爲給遏制了。

sentences.english: But non-state actors are harder to deter.
sentences.chinese: 但是，非國家行爲者則難以遏制。

sentences.english: A second hormone has an opposite effect and damps exuberance.
sentences.chinese: 另外一種荷爾蒙會產生相反的作用，會遏制繁榮。

sentences.english: The cholera outbreak has been contained.
sentences.chinese: 霍亂的爆發已被遏制住。

sentences.english: This stifles the development of the financial sector.
sentences.chinese: 這就遏制了金融部門的發展。

sentences.english: It is also said to be effective in curbing scalping, especially during the Spring Festival period.
sentences.chinese: 據說，它也能夠有效地遏制倒票，尤其是在春節期間。

sentences.english: On the other side, Johnson did it with Bosingwa.
sentences.chinese: 而在另一邊，約翰遜同樣很好的遏制了博辛瓦。

sentences.english: Authorities have imposed a three-day curfew in the capital to contain the clashes.
sentences.chinese: 首都巴格達已開始實施爲期三天的宵禁以遏制衝突。

sentences.english: Reports the same month from Laos revealed the ongoing poaching of tiger.
sentences.chinese: 當月老撾報道稱，偷獵老虎的行徑仍沒有得到遏制。

sentences.english: Beijing's challenge lies in staunching these inflows.
sentences.chinese: 中國政府面臨的挑戰在於遏制此類資金流入。

definition: to hit/to strike/to attack/to crack down on sth/blow/(psychological) shock/percussion (music)
to be on guard/wariness/to guard against/preventive
to take strict precautions/on your guard
